Meet the Team
OLGA
Olga Connolly
Outgoing Managing Director
Olga moved to the beautiful woods of Gadsden County in 1994. A year later, she completed her Ph.D. in Commonwealth Literature at Florida State University, beginning a career in teaching, writing, and editing that spanned another two decades.
Her love of theatre began during graduate school, when she picked up the theatre column for the Florida Flambeau. She likes to say that her first 30 dates with her husband were spent at the back of a theatre, writing copy by flashlight. But it was Quincy Music Theatre that really captured her imagination. For the last sixteen years, she has done props, costumes, lightboard and spot, crew, and a multitude of other tasks and builds at QMT. From 2018 – 2019, she also served as President of the QMT Board
.
CRAIG
Craig Grafmiller
Scenic Carpenter
Craig has been building and creating for as long as he can remember. Growing up on a dairy farm, he learned early on how to solve problems with his hands and make things work. That foundation has served him well through a 37-year career as a Mechanical Design Engineer, where he’s become expert at reading blueprints, using CAD software and bringing designs to life. His engineering background gives him a unique perspective on set construction, combining technical precision with practical craftsmanship. When he’s not at his day job, you’ll find Craig working on home renovation projects or volunteering with First Presbyterian Church of Quincy, where he has built access ramps and stairs for people with disabilities through Florida Cares.
Craig started as a volunteer builder at QMT and quickly became an invaluable part of the team. His exceptional craftsmanship and dedication led to his transition into the role of part-time Scenic Carpenter. He’s excited to bring his skills to each new production and tackle whatever creative challenges come his way at QMT.
COLLINS
Collins Cudjoe
Intern
Collins Cudjoe is a student at Florida State University with a passion for theatre management and a goal of one day leading a regional theatre. As an intern at Quincy Music Theatre, Collins is gaining hands-on experience across all areas of production and operations, supporting both front-of-house and behind-the-scenes efforts.
With a strong appreciation for community-driven storytelling and the role of the arts in creating connection, Collins brings energy, insight and a collaborative spirit to the QMT team. His time at QMT is part of his journey toward becoming a thoughtful and dynamic leader in the world of theatre.
ALUMNI SECTION
Intern Alumni
WILL TAYLOR
Set Design Intern
2023–2024
DIANA BAXTER
Production Intern
2024
JOSHUA SIMON
Production Intern
2023
.entry-content

.entry-content

About Quincy Music Theatre
About the Theatre
Located less than 30 minutes west of the heart of Tallahassee, Quincy Music Theatre is North Florida’s largest all-musical community theater. Since 1984, Quincy Music Theatre has featured decades of top-quality performances from musicians, actors, artists, choreographers, dancers, technical theater professionals and directors throughout the greater Big Bend area.
Quincy Music Theatre puts on six to seven shows a year. With just over 300 seats and six performances, there is always a spot for you to experience live theatre with us!
Our Mission
The theatre is committed to community cultural, and economic growth, pride, and inclusion. Its mission is to provide quality experiences in musical theatre that are shared by all artistic, volunteer, audience, and donor participants in Gadsden County and the Big Bend Area of Florida.
Hours & Location
Daily Box Office hours Vary. Please schedule an appointment to come by via our
contact page
. The box office is also always open one hour before each performance.The theatre is located in downtown Quincy, Florida at 118 E Washington Street.

Contact Us
Need to exchange your show tickets?
Locate your ticket confirmation email from ThunderTix.
Click the “Exchange your Tickets” button/link in the email.
Select the tickets you want to exchange.
Choose a new event or performance from the available options.
Proceed to checkout to finalize the exchange.
This process allows customers to swap their tickets without needing direct assistance from theatre staff. If this “button” is NOT visible in your email, please submit your request via the below contact form.
Contact Form
The Box Office is open Wednesday-Friday from 2-5 and 1 hour before each performance. To receive the fastest response, please fill out your inquiry in the below contact form. We typically respond within 1-3 business days. For urgent matters, please include ‘URGENT’ at the beginning of your subject line so we can prioritize your request.
Loading…
Phone:
850-875-9444
NOTE: Phone line is not monitored daily
.entry-content
